description:
This is a Proctored Exam using the online proctoring software Proctorio. If you have trouble with Proctorio visit this link.  PROCTORIO LINK

You will have 1 attempt for this exam. No additional time or re-entry into the exam will be allowed. Do not submit until you have completed the exam. You must submit the exam once you have completed it or your allotted time is up. Failure to submit the exam may result in late submissions or incomplete. This exam is not open book or open note, nor is this exam a collaborative assignment. Outside resources are not allowed during this exam. 

If you have technical difficulties during an exam, you must notify me immediately- Ideally by text AND/OR phone.

Dr. Jones 559 970-3754

name: Lecture Exam 3 (Remotely Proctored)

description:
Prompt:

Read "15.4 Planning a Healthy Diet" on pages 299-300 in your textbook and review Figure 15.15 on page 300.  Answer the discussion questions below. 

Discussion Questions:

1. Describe your diet. Would you consider it to be healthy or unhealthy? Why?

2. Do you have any food allergies?

3. Are there specific foods you avoid because of the taste or texture? What are your favorite foods and why?

4. Share anything else regarding the importance of having a healthy diet. 

 

Guidelines:

This discussion will be required for attendance and participation. Each student will only be able to communicate with their group which will be assigned by Canvas.

Respond to the discussion question with a thoughtful, researched answer. Your post should be 2-3 paragraphs and supported with references to reliable resources.

Reply to at least 2 classmate's posts. Your response should add to the discussion by reflecting on their response or asking clarifying questions.

As a reminder, the weekly discussion prompts are due WEDNESDAYS at 11:59 p.m.

Rules to Keep in Mind:

Use proper grammar and punctuation.

Be polite.

A the question fully.

Respond by due date.

No late posts will be accepted.

Technical Support:

Need help using Canvas discussions? Use the links below for help. 

How do I view the rubric for my graded discussion? (Links to an external site.)

How do I reply to a discussion as a student? (Links to an external site.)

How do I attach a file to a discussion reply as a student? (Links to an external site.)

How do I edit or delete discussion replies as a student?

description:
Week 12: Lecture Participation/Attendance Quiz (Digestion)

Please complete the following:

  • view the recorded live zoom lecture/s for this week

Answer the following questions for attendance and participation points.

You will only have one attempt. This quiz is timed.

Rubric:

Score:

      • less than 75%- participation determined by score received.
      • 75% or greater- full credit participation point awarded.
name: Week 15: Lecture Participation Quiz (Digestion)

description:
Purpose

In lab this week, we will learn about the digestive system. As animals, we must consume organic matter to obtain the building blocks and energy we need to grow and survive. For example, we need glucose or another source of chemical energy to create ATP during cellular respiration, and we get this energy source from the food we eat. We would not be able to do this without our digestive system! The purpose of the digestive system is to break down ingested food and liquid, absorb the released nutrients, and eliminate any leftover waste products. In this lab, we will learn to identify the major organs of the digestive system and the roles that they play to help the system carry out its functions. We will also learn about how to read nutrition labels to better understand healthy eating and the nutritional value of various foods.

Learning Objectives

  1. Identify the structures of the digestive system and describe their functions
  2. Describe the layers that make up the walls of the digestive tract organs
  3. Describe the nutritional components and macromolecule make-up of foods

Instructions

This week we will complete Lab #15

Click this linked text to download Lab 15: Digestive System

 

  1. Print out the lab PDFs. Review the lab presentation (if available). 
  2. Go to lab and have fun! Complete the questions, drawings, graphs, etc. in your lab manual.

After you attend and complete the lab activities, come back here to upload your document:

  1. Use one of the apps or methods below to convert your printed worksheet into a single pdf. Please do not upload a separate file for each page.
  2. Upload the single pdf of your lab manual to the assignment. 
  3. Submit the assignment before the deadline.
  4. Your instructor will give you the access code for the Lab Quiz in class if you were present and participating the whole lab period. Be sure to write down the access code on your lab so you don't forget it!

 

Apps for converting images to pdfs

    1. Notes App in iPhone/iPad - How to scan documents using the Apple Notes App
    2. Google Drive - How to scan documents using the Google Drive app
    3. Genius Scan - How to make a multi-page PDF in Genius Scan
    4. CamScanner - Scan multiple images with CamScanner
    5. Adobe Scan - Scan multiple pages with Adobe Scan to PDF
    6. Maybe you have a scanner at home that will scan your work directly to your computer.
    7. As a last resort you can also take a picture of each page and add them all to a word document to upload. They must be uploaded as a single document.

Resources

  • Amoeba Sisters: Digestive system (opens to YouTube)
  • TED-Ed: What is a calorie? (opens to YouTube)
  • GCSE Biology: What are nutrients? (opens to YouTube)

Click Next to Continue.
name: Lab 15: The Digestive System

description:
THE DIGESTIVE SYSTEM & NUTRITION

Getting Started:

Please read the lab manual, review the agenda (below), and review the lab quiz questions (below) prior to the start of each lab so you know what information you need. Links to images of models, diagrams, slides, videos and materials needed to complete the labs are provided below.

You will need access to a phone/ tablet/ computer that can download and modify images to be uploaded to your lab exercises in Canvas. Images must be in one of the following formats: jpg, pdf, doc. No other image uploads will be accepted. All lab images for upload must be digitally labeled and unique to each student.

Please review all materials and label images for study. NOTE: lab manual completion will be uploaded as the lab participation assignment on Canvas. Late submissions will not be accepted.  

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: DIGESTIVE SYSTEM & NUTRITION ACTIVITIES & QUIZ

description:
FN 35 paper

Due April 18th, 2024

Total points: 110

Submission via Canvas PDF or WORD document only, No Google Doc

Choose a topic that interests you or something you want to learn more about.  You may use any of the resources available to you: the library, books, the internet, interviews, journals, etc.

Possible topics: Alcohol, Antioxidants, Butter vs. Margarine, Cancer (select one type of cancer to focus on), Child nutrition and health, Cholesterol and diet, Coffee, Diabetes, Diet Drinks (diet soft drinks, diet soda), Dieting (weight loss diets), Digestive disease and associated disorders, Eggs and Heart disease, Fitness, Sports, and Sports Nutrition, Fraud and Nutrition misinformation, Multivitamins, Vegetarian Nutrition, School lunches, Depression and Nutrition, Fast food restaurants, Sugar and obesity, sugar substitutes, Obesity treatment: lifestyle, medications and surgery.  Please email me if you want to write on a different topic not listed above.

This paper requires you to write from a third-person point of view.  Use pronouns such as he, him, his, himself, it, its, itself, they, them, theirs, themselves.   Avoid using pronouns such as I, me, my, mine, and myself.  Please DO NOT talk about yourself, your opinions, or what happened to you.  This is a short nutrition research paper.  Pick a topic that interests you, learn about it, and focus on the nutrition aspect of it.  For example, if your topic is Alcohol, write about how that affects nutrition status, quality of diet, or nutrition consequences.  There is no need to include your personal feelings about the subject.

Other requirements: 

At least 3 pages, typed, double spaced, font size 12

An introduction (the purpose of the paper), body (don't forget to provide citations), conclusion (summary of the paper)

Three different sources of information, such as books, journals, internet.  Citations should be provided using MLA/APA format.
name: Nutrition paper

description:
ASSIGNMENT

Choosing a topic for the persuasive speech is a challenging task. I am asking for you to choose a topic early so you may have more time to research. I also will approve topics so you are not left with a topic that may not be persuasive or have a lot of research. 

TASK

To receive full credit for this assignment please provide me with the follow information 

  1. Give me your topic area for the Persuasive speech.
  2. Detail one aspect of this topic to demonstrate the specific of the argument.
  3. Tell me which side of the topic you stand.
  4. Provide one citation that helps support the strength of your topic and your viewpoint of the topic.
  5. Explain why this topic is relevant to your audience.
name: Persuasive Topic Proposal
